etymology.description: Pictogram (象形) – a vertical stroke and a horizontal stroke bisecting each other; original character of 切 (“to cut”).
etymology.interpretation: A cross-like cut mark is depicted, suggesting an incision where one line cuts across another. This graph was later employed to write the numeral seven; the modern form preserves the crossing strokes that reflect the original cutting imagery.

examples.chinese: 我今年七岁(我今年七歲)。
examples.english: I am seven years old this year.

examples.chinese: 我们七个人一起去旅行(我們七個人一起去旅行)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qī gè rén yìqǐ qù lǚxíng.
examples.english: The seven of us are traveling together.

examples.chinese: 比赛在七点开始(比賽在七點開始)。
examples.english: The game starts at seven o’clock.
